intro: Cotoneaster simonsii var. newryensis, commonly known as Newry cotoneaster, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of western China. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by bright red berries in the autumn. The plant has elliptical, glossy leaves that turn yellow in the fall, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its hardy nature and attractive foliage, it is a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
